statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: San Diego 104, Point Loma 57
article.story:
SAN DIEGO (AP) -- Corey Belser scored a career-high 28 points and
Nick Lewis added 16 as the University of San Diego beat Point Loma
Nazarene 104-57 Thursday night.

It was the fifth victory in a row for the West Coast Conference
Toreros (6-2, 0-0). Point Loma fell to 5-4 overall (5-2 in NAIA
play).

Belser , a 6-7 senior, connected on his first nine shots from
the field in the first half, including four-of-four from
three-point land as the Toreros took a 47-37 lead at intermission.

Lewis scored eight of his 16 points in the first 10 minutes of
the second half as the Toreros ran off to a 25-point lead, 68-43,
and coasted home.

San Diego shot 40-for-68 (63 percent) from the floor with Belser
finishing 11 of 14.

Gyno Pomare and Brandon Johnson joined Belser and Lewis in
double figures with 11 points apiece.

Tim Kruge led Point Loma with 18 points while Casey Ortiz had 12
and Xavier Lopez 11.

San Diego also set a school record with 19 steals. Theo White
came away with four and Belser and Ross DeRogatis had three each.
The previous record was 17, set Jan. 9, 1982 against
Nebraska-Wesleyan.
